Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery thick-walled vessel, fabric black in section, interior slightly grooved and covered with traces of a resinous deposit, exterior covered with a brown-red slip and with remains of seven lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now faded and worn in places, containing a receipt.
Curator's comments: This ostracon may be compared with 1923,0327.141 (O.Sarga 196), 1923,0327.226 (O.Sarga 197), 1923,0327.199 (O.Sarga 198) and 1923,0327.469 (O.Sarga 203); but its form, which, as with the other ostraca beginning with a date, suggests a receipt, makes the present position the more appropriate.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.180)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36504) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36504)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 275 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13550 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
